messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 830
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/14/00 6:03:20 AM Eastern Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/14/00 6:03:20 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:

<< I wonder how many people out there are homeschooling an only child. I
have a six year old boy that we unschool. The older he gets the more
self directed he gets. >>

Sherry

I do not have experience unschooling one child, although i do have one child,
who is 3 and we are commited to HS. We have been trying for another child for
about a year too. I just turned 35 and feel we should have had success by
now (but who knows). I guess I can't offer advice, as I have a younger child
than you, but i will say i have read anecdotals about HS families which
include vignettes about one child HS families, just because they do exist out
there in the pool of homeschoolers. Congratulations on helping your child
to be the self-directed learner he is.

cath (montreal)
